content.title: Avocado  is  a specific product, usually it is either very much loved or not eaten at all. But we strongly recommend including it in the diet, since it is a whole storehouse of nutrients for women's health and beauty. Today we will tell you in detail how avocado is useful.

content.text: Avocado is the fruit of the American Perseus plant , also called the alligator pear. By the way, avocado is a fruit, not a vegetable. The peculiarity of its fruits is that they can ripen, being already removed from the tree. Such a rare property, in addition to avocado, is also characteristic of bananas.

The fruit contains many vitamins and minerals. It is high in vitamin K, C, B5, B6, E and folic acid. Avocado is one of the best natural sources of potassium, and it offers many other important nutrients: manganese, magnesium, iron, zinc, phosphorus, and copper. A medium-sized avocado provides 160 calories, as well as protein, healthy fats, a minimum of carbohydrates and dietary fiber.

Avocado fits perfectly into the diet of people with heart problems. It contains monounsaturated fatty acids that help keep blood cholesterol levels low by controlling blood pressure. The beta-sitosterol present in avocados helps protect your heart from atherosclerosis, and significant amounts of potassium act as a vasodilator, relaxing blood vessels and arteries, preventing blood clots and raising blood pressure. Studies have shown that regular consumption of avocados can significantly reduce the risk of heart disease and heart attack.

Avocados are effective in improving eye health. In addition to their vitamin A content, these fruits are also rich in a number of carotenoids: lutein and zeaxanthin, which protect the eyes from age-related degeneration. It can be helpful in preventing cataracts and macular degeneration. The antioxidants present in avocados help provide comprehensive protection to the optic nerves, contributing to improved vision and eye health.

Avocados are able to speed up the digestion process in the body. It contains both soluble and insoluble fiber that aid in digestion. Fiber also stimulates the secretion of digestive juices, which greatly facilitates the digestion of the stomach and aids in better absorption of nutrients from food. Fiber also helps in treating constipation.

Avocados are very effective in providing the body with nutrients that help fight irregular cell division and unnatural growth. The carotenoids and monounsaturated fats present in avocados can help fight breast and prostate cancer. The antioxidant glutathione stops free radicals from acting on the cells of the body, helping to prevent cancer. The active ingredients present in avocados can even contribute to the death of cancer cells.

Avocado is good not only for the skin, but also for the hair. It nourishes them with vitamins and minerals that can lead to hair loss in the event of a deficiency in the body. Thus, by including avocado in your diet, you can ensure good hair health. In addition, avocado can be used as a hair mask to make it look more beautiful and shiny.

Suitable for short hair half fruit, and for long  -  a whole. Rub the avocado pulp through a sieve, then add the yolk of one egg and half a teaspoon of olive oil. Cover the entire length of the hair with the mixture and leave on for 25 minutes. Then wash your hair well as usual with shampoo and conditioner. The mask will give the hair a shine, smooth texture and reduce hair breakage.
Now that you know about the amazing health and beauty benefits of avocado, include it in your diet and also use it as a personal care product for maximum benefits.
